content.raw: The transforms should match because of the code in [DARTJoint::Init](https://bitbucket.org/pchorak/gazebo/src/670ba13937f21efd2e4c9d455e1a50b948b03864/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTJoint.cc?at=dart_kinematic_loops&fileviewer=file-view-default#DARTJoint.cc-74). While the DART loop joint has the slave body node as its child, the Gazebo joint still has the original link as its child. So, when the Gazebo loop joint sets the transforms for its corresponding DART (loop) joint, it does so as if the original link were its child, so the frames should be consistent. I confirmed this by printing the transforms for the `free_loop` and `anchored_loop` world.
